newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian coalition said to meet on oil prices Aug 21.
newsitem.headline: Indian coalition said to meet on oil prices Aug 21.

text.p: Indian Finance Minister P. Chidambaram was quoted on Thursday as saying the ruling United Front coalition will decide on August 21 whether to raise oil prices.

The Press Trust of India (PTI) quoted Chidambaram as telling the upper house of parliament that Prime Minister Inder Kumar Gujral's cabinet would take a final decision on petroleum product prices after the August 21 meeting.
The news agency quoted Chidambaram as saying that if "the administered prices deserve to be corrected, it will be corrected".

On Wednesday, the United Front's decision-making Steering Committee deferred a decision on whether to raise oil prices but coalition members said an increase was inevitable and would come soon. They did not say when the alliance would meet again.
PTI quoted Chidmabaram as saying that the government had increased oil prices last year, and the inflation rate later fell back to four percent after rising initially to six.
"We do not wish to put any unusual burden on the people," PTI quoted the finance minister as saying.
